subject: Management
title: The Growth Mindset for Leaders
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Growth Mindset for Leaders usable.

hook.text: A VP said: I'm just not a people person. She used it as a permanent excuse.

buildup.text: Fixed mindset leaders believe their abilities are set. Growth mindset leaders believe they can improve.

discovery.text: Carol Dweck's research: mindset determines whether leaders improve or stagnate over time.

twist.text: Growth mindset leaders seek feedback, embrace challenge, and learn from failure.

climax.text: She reframed: I'm not a people person yet. Then she started learning. And she got better.

punchline.text: Add the word yet. It changes everything.

quiz.question: How does growth mindset affect leadership?
options: Leaders who believe they can improve actually do improve over time
Mindset has no measurable effect on leadership ability
Fixed mindset leaders are more decisive and consistent
